What a great idea! Air fryers are perfect for roasting vegetables, and they can help retain their crunch and flavor. Yes, you can definitely roast the vegetables in your air fryer, and I'd be happy to guide you through the adjustments you'll need to make.

**Advantages of air frying vegetables:**

1. **Faster cooking time**: Air fryers cook faster than traditional ovens, which means you'll have your roasted vegetables ready in no time.
2. **Crispy texture**: Air fryers use little to no oil, which helps preserve the natural crunch and texture of the vegetables.
3. **Easy to cook**: Simply toss the vegetables with your desired seasonings, load them into the air fryer basket, and set the temperature and time.

**Adjustments for air frying vegetables:**

1. **Temperature**: Reduce the temperature by 25-50°F (15-25°C) compared to oven roasting. This will help prevent burning and promote even cooking. For example, if a recipe calls for 425°F (220°C) in the oven, try 375-400°F (190-200°C) in the air fryer.
2. **Cooking time**: Cooking time will be significantly shorter in an air fryer. As a general rule, reduce the cooking time by 30-50% compared to oven roasting. For example, if a recipe calls for 20-25 minutes in the oven, try 10-15 minutes in the air fryer.
3. **Shaking and stirring**: Halfway through the cooking time, shake the air fryer basket or stir the vegetables to ensure even cooking and prevent hotspots.
4. **Moisture control**: Air fryers can dry out vegetables quickly, so make sure to adjust the cooking time and temperature accordingly. If you notice the vegetables are drying out, reduce the temperature or add a splash of water to the air fryer.

**Specific air fryer settings for the vegetables I mentioned earlier:**

* Korean Radish (Daikon): 375°F (190°C), 10-12 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Carrots: 400°F (200°C), 12-15 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Brussels Sprouts: 400°F (200°C), 10-12 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Sweet Potatoes: 400°F (200°C), 15-18 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Zucchini: 375°F (190°C), 8-10 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Mushrooms: 375°F (190°C), 10-12 minutes, shaking halfway through
* Broccoli: 400°F (200°C), 10-12 minutes, shaking halfway through

Remember to monitor the vegetables' progress and adjust the cooking time and temperature as needed. You can always cook them in batches if you need to, and don't hesitate to experiment with different seasoning combinations and cooking times to find your perfect air-fried vegetable recipe!
